data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You do not usually walk forward if you are facing forward. Each of the first eight steps requires that you go away from you. Since you cannot take backwards steps, you will need to take 5 steps backwards the first time you do it. Then the second time you do it, use both your right and your left foot to come back. If you retrace your steps backwards until you start from the start, the last two steps are still gone. To take backwards steps, take 7 + 7 = 21 steps. If you repeat steps like this four times: First time you go back 4 times, take 6 + 8 = 24. The following steps are the same as the first four times: First time you go back, take 7 + 7 = 29 steps. Third time you go back, take 9 + 7 = 30 steps. The first two steps are the same as the first two times: First time you go back inward, take 7 + 9 = 54 steps. The third time you go back inward, take 2 + 5 = 15 steps. So, the answer is No.

We also know that if you always face forward, and you travel away from where you started, you cannot return to the starting point with the same point. If you always face forward and go to the starting point from the same direction, you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
